Why would you want to do this? The customer convenience factor is so high, you just have to consider it a cost of doing business. To fly so much in the face of customer want doesn't make sense to me.

answers.author: Donald Patterson
answers.text:
Credit cards, pay-by-phone, tap cards and other electronic payment methods are popular because of the customer convenience, increased collection rates, and reduced shrinkage rates. You should adjust your fees/rates to reflect the cost of doing business.

Credit card fees can be high, but there are numerous ways to ensure you pay the lowest possible fee.  Check out the April Issue of Public Management magazine, page 31 or this link - http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9503/public/management.cfm?title=Management%20Minute&subtitle=&author=        for tips on reducing those fees.  If you want to discuss further, give me a call.  301-467-4832.

author: Steven Downs
text: What have other cities done to incentivize customers to discontinue the use of credit cards and use other forms of payments?  Both the credit card fees and the number of customers using credit cards are rapidly increasing resulting in a significant loss of revenue.
title: Credit Card Fees
